analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Dhamma Paccanīyas in Direct Order, The Tikas on the Paṭṭhāna Sutta

original: 23.48. Sanidassanattika, Ācayagāmittika🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naācayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anidassanaappaṭigho ācayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naapacayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anidassanaappaṭigho apacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: sani dassana ttika ācaya gāmittika  na sanidassana sappaṭigham na ācaya gāmim dhammam paccayā anidassana appaṭighaḥ ācaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sanidassana sappaṭigham na apacaya gāmim dhammam paccayā anidassana appaṭighaḥ apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart,🔽With-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart, not leading to diminution, are conditions, as root-cause condition, for with-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart, not leading to diminution. (In brief.) As to root-cause, there are three; … as to non-hindrance, there are three.🔽With-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart, not leading to increase, are conditions, as root-cause condition, for with-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart, leading to increase. (In brief.) As to root-cause, there are three; … as to non-hindrance, there are three.

analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na na iva ācaya gāminā na apacaya gāmim dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart, neither leading to increase nor leading to diminution, are conditions, as root-cause condition, for with-object-of-consciousness, with-counterpart,

original: nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekavīsa,
analyzed: na iva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekavīsa
translated: neither leading to increase nor leading to diminution. (In brief.) As to root-cause, there are twenty-one;
as to predominance, there are twenty-one; … as to non-hindrance, there are twenty-one.
